Cinderace.overview: These sets are for a new and developing metagame. If you have any questions about the sets, feel free to ask any in the Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Discussion thread.

sets.name: SUPER STRIKER (Gigantamax Attacker)
sets.description:
• With its great Attack, Speed, and Libero, Cinderace finds itself in a commanding position in the BSS metagame.

  • Pyro Ball becomes G-Max Fireball under Gigantamax, a 160-Base Power attack that also nullifies abilities like Mimikyu's Disguise and Heatran's Flash Fire.

  • Bounce gives Cinderace access to Max Airstream, which makes it a very potent sweeper, having nearly unmatched Speed alongside its colorful movepool and Libero.

  • Sucker Punch may seem odd on a set revolving around Max Airstream, but it can be useful in situations where Cinderace doesn't have a boost, such as revenge killing.

  • Giga Impact provides Cinderace with an obscenely powerful Max Strike, which is useful for both its wide neutral coverage and the Speed drop, which lets it maintain the Speed advantage in Dynamax battles against Zapdos without relying on Max Airstream. Max Strike is also Cinderace's strongest option against Quagsire.

  • Gunk Shot grants valuable coverage against Fairy-types such as Xerneas and Tapu Fini.

  • Iron Head still covers Xerneas while giving Cinderace access to Max Steelspike for Defense boosts.

Items

  • Life Orb elevates Cinderace's damage output even further, making it extremely difficult to wall.

  • Assault Vest grants Cinderace some extra survivability, potentially allowing it to get a crucial second hit off against Pokemon like Zapdos.

sets.name: Focus Sash
sets.description:
• Focus Sash Cinderace makes for a powerful general attacker and great lead, starting most games off with a bang.

  • High Jump Kick is Cinderace's strongest attack outside of Dynamax.

  • Counter and Focus Sash allow Cinderace to trade KOs with physical threats such as Zacian-C, Urshifu-S, and Landorus-T, potentially removing them from the game immediately.

  • Sucker Punch provides powerful priority, picking off weakened targets such as Calyrex-S.

  • Gunk Shot provides valuable coverage against Xerneas and Tapu Fini. Iron Head still hits Xerneas supper effectively, but it sacrifices damage against Tapu Fini for the chance to cause foes to flinch so that Cinderace can then KO them.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description:
• Choice Scarf Cinderace can use its fantastic Speed to be a great pivot and terrifying revenge killer.

  • Thanks to Cinderace's very high natural Speed, Choice Scarf lets it prevent Ditto from reverse sweeping after copying fast foes like bulky Zacian-C.

  • High Jump Kick is Cinderace's strongest attack outside of Dynamax.

  • Gunk Shot provides valuable coverage against Fairy-types, namely Xerneas and Tapu Fini.

  • Iron Head provides more accurate coverage on Xerneas and a potentially useful flinch chance to bring foes into KO range, but it sacrifices a lot of damage.

  • While Sucker Punch may seem odd on a Choice Scarf set, the coverage against Calyrex-S is extremely valuable, especially against Choice Scarf variants and certain other Speed-boosted Pokemon, which outspeed even Choice Scarf Cinderace.

Corviknight.overview:
This analysis covers a Pokemon in a very new metagame. The metagame may shift rapidly. If you have any suggestions for this analysis, please post them in the current Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Thread.

Viability Ranking: B Rank

Reserved for Pokemon that are great in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame. These Pokemon have more notable flaws than those above them that affect how they function in the format. Their positive traits still outshine their negatives, but they require a bit more team support to bring out their full potential.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

sets.name: Physically Defensive
sets.description:
• When running maximum Defense investment alongside Iron Defense, Corviknight is a good physical wall that has several tools to differentiate itself from Celesteela, such as Roost.

  • Body Press alongside Iron Defense makes Corviknight very difficult to defeat with physical attacks following a boost and allows it to deal incredibly high damage with Body Press following Defense boosts.

  • Brave Bird allows Corviknight to hit Ghost-types and boost its Speed with Max Airstream, but Iron Head can be used to help ease the matchup against Swords Dance Mimikyu. Taunt can also be run here to stop status moves like Yawn, but this leaves Corviknight unable to damage Ghost-types.

  • Avoid using Dynamax on Corviknight unless it needs it to survive hits in a pinch, such as switching in against a boosted Mimikyu. Corviknight will lose the massive damage output from Iron Defense-boosted Body Press, and its damage output is tame against any Pokemon with decent defenses.

  • Mirror Armor is preferred over Pressure in order to survive against Max Phantasm Defense drops, allowing Corviknight to effectively defeat standard Mimikyu and physical Dragapult sets. This also punishes Intimidate Pokemon such as Landorus-T, Salamence, and Gyarados

Items

  • Sitrus Berry is the primary item, which helps Corviknight avoid many 2HKOs, such as Cinderace's Pyro Ball.

  • Leftovers can be used for long-term health recovery if that is preferred.

  • Rocky Helmet can be used for chip damage in matchups such as against Urshifu-R.

sets.name: Specially Defensive
sets.description:
• Near-maximum special bulk and Maranga Berry allow Corviknight to consistently survive weaker super effective attacks and set up on Pokemon that would otherwise check it.

  • Taunt is the more traditional option for shutting down passive Pokemon, but Substitute can be used for stalling out PP more effectively or setting up on weak special attacks.

  • Pressure is the preferred ability to stall out weak super effective special attacks, but Mirror Armor can still be useful to help against Intimidate users, Mystical Fire attackers, and Max Phantasm users.

  • Dynamax allows Corviknight to survive otherwise lethal hits and can be used to sweep after Bulk Up boosts have been accumulated.

  • The given EV spread is designed to be as specially bulky as possible while still being able to outspeed defensive Celesteela and Iron Defense Corviknight sets to Taunt them.

sets.name: Fast Taunt
sets.description:
• This Corviknight set takes advantage of its relatively good natural bulk, Speed investment, and Bulk Up to outspeed the majority of bulky metagame options to take advantage of passive foes and opposing Corviknight to sweep opposing teams with boosted Brave Bird or Max Airstream.

  • Taunt is used to shut down status and boosting moves, allowing Corviknight to gain an advantage over slower Pokemon that have trouble damaging it. such as Hippowdon and Ferrothorn.

  • Substitute can be used to gain an advantage over status users while also easing prediction against foes switching out.

  • This Corviknight wants to Dynamax after setting up Bulk Up and when its natural checks, such as Rotom forms, are removed from the game or severely damaged. Following Speed boosts from Max Airstream, Corviknight becomes difficult to deal with for offensively oriented teams, as it will outspeed most Choice Scarf users at +2 Speed.

  • Mirror Armor is used to help beat Mimikyu one-on-one, outspeeding it after a Max Airstream and reversing Defense drops from Max Phantasm. It also let Corviknight punish Intimidate Pokemon such as Landorus-T, Salamence, and Gyarados.

Items

  • Lum Berry is used with Taunt generally to allow Corviknight to switch into moves such as Yawn, breaking Stealth Rock + Yawn cycles.

  • Leftovers is generally used in combination with Substitute, to gain passive health while being protected by Substitute.

EV Spreads

  • 108 HP / 148 Atk / 252 Spe with a Jolly nature: Maximum Speed allows this Corviknight to effectively Taunt all Corviknight while still having decent attacking power and health through partial investment in Attack and HP. It also can outspeed Jolly Cinderace at +1 Speed.

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 Spe with a Jolly nature: This is a simple spread to maximize HP and Speed; it also lets Corviknight outspeed everything up to Jolly Cinderace at +1 Speed and survive hits better than the 148 Attack spread.

  • 252 HP / 60 Atk / 196 Spe with an Adamant nature: This EV spread allows Corviknight to outspeed positive-natured base 100 Speed Pokemon after a Max Airstream.

sets.name: Weakness Policy
sets.description:
• This Corviknight set is designed to bait in super effective attacks, using the combination of Dynamax and Corviknight's superb natural bulk to easily survive these attacks and hit back lethally with Max Airstream.

  • Bulk Up is the boosting move of choice, allowing Corviknight to augment its Attack when not in Dynamax forme, allowing it to hit harder and making it more difficult to take down with physical attacks.

  • Iron Head gives Corviknight a great chance to OHKO Dynamax Togekiss with Max Steelspike after Weakness Policy is activated.

  • Power Trip can be used to deal massive damage following Dynamax expiring through stat boost accumulation.

  • Body Press gives Attack boosts with Max Knuckle and allows Corviknight to hit Steel-types more effectively than other options.

  • Taunt allows you to stifle slower status moves, allowing Corviknight to set up on passive Pokemon.

EV Spreads

  • 252 HP / 4 Def / 252 Spe with a Jolly nature: This is a simple spread to maximize HP and Speed; it also allows Corviknight to outspeed everything up to Jolly Cinderace at +1 Speed and survive hits better than the spreads invested in Attack.

  • 252 HP / 100 Atk / 156 Spe with an Adamant nature: These EVs are designed to outspeed positive-natured Dragapult after two Max Airstreams.

Eternatus.overview: These sets are for one of the final Battle Stadium Singles metagames for this generation. If you feel there is anything wrong or missing, please post in this thread.

sets.name: Defensive
sets.description:
EV Spreads

  • 244 HP / 228 Def / 36 Spe: This physically bulky spread outspeeds Palkia and Garchomp.

  • 244 HP / 4 Def / 4 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe: This maximizes Eternatus's Speed and bulk, allowing it to at least Speed tie with offensive Eternatus.

sets.name: Offensive
sets.description:
Items

  • Power Herb: This allows Eternatus to boost its Special Attack with Meteor Beam, which is also deals massive damage to Ho-Oh.

  • Life Orb: When using Recover, Life Orb is the best offensive item for Eternatus.

EV Spreads

  • 76 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpA / 4 SpD / 172 Spe with Modest: With this spread, Eternatus OHKOes offensive Yveltal with a +1 Dynamax Cannon after Stealth Rock damage, and outspeeds both Palkia and Garchomp. 4 Defense EVs can be removed to deal with Porygon2's Download better, but it's not a particularly common Pokemon.

  • 252 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Timid: This spread maximizes Eternatus's Speed, letting it outspeed Jolly Marshadow and Speed tie with Adamant Zacian-C.

sets.name: Choice Item Attacker
sets.description:
Items

  • Choice Specs: Choice Specs Eternatus slices through Dynamax foes, being able to OHKO offensive Yveltal after Stealth Rock damage with Dynamax Cannon in particular.

  • Choice Scarf With Choice Scarf, Eternatus becomes an effective revenge killer of several Dragon-types, such as Zekrom and Palkia.

EV Spreads

  • 76 HP / 4 Def / 252 SpA / 4 SpD / 172 Spe with Modest: The Speed investment outpaces Palkia and Garchomp. If the rare Porygon2 poses an issue, the 4 Defense EVs can be removed to avoid a Download boost.

  • 252 SpA / 4 SpD / 252 Spe with Timid: With maximum Speed investment, Eternatus can now outspeed Jolly Marshadow and Timid Lugia, and speed tie with Adamant Zacian-C at worst.

Urshifu.overview: These sets are for a new and developing metagame. If you have any questions about the sets, feel free to ask any in the Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Discussion thread.

sets.name: Focus Sash
sets.description:
• With its high Attack stat, great STAB combination, and absolute nuke that is Wicked Blow, Urshifu-S has made a name for itself as one of the most threatening wallbreakers in the BSS metagame.

  • With Focus Sash and Counter, Urshifu-S is also a potent revenge killer against physical threats.

  • This variant of Urshifu-S makes for a solid lead, trading very efficiently with strong physical attackers such as Zacian-C and Landorus-T.

  • Outside of the lead slot, Urshifu-S must be wary of Stealth Rock and other entry hazards nullifying its Focus Sash, and thus making Counter less consistent.

  • Sucker Punch provides powerful priority, allowing Urshifu-S to finish off Pokemon that survived Counter or Wicked Blow the turn prior.

  • Rock Tomb is difficult to fit in, but the Speed control it gives is very useful and unexpected from foes.

  • Taunt is potentially useful to help Urshifu-S break through the likes of Quagsire and Toxapex by preventing them from recovering. However giving up Counter or Sucker Punch severely limits Urshifu-S’s potential against offensive Pokémon.

  • While this variant of Urshifu-S usually won’t be using it, Gigantamax is preferred over Dynamax because G-Max One Blow's secondary effect helps Urshifu-S much more than Max Darkness’s.

sets.name: BEAR KNUCKLE (Choice Item Attacker)
sets.description:
• Wicked Blow is Urshifu-S's main attack, with the guaranteed critical hit providing extreme damage and bypassing Defense boosts or Attack drops

  • Sucker Punch is powerful priority to pick off weakened, faster targets such as Regieleki, boosted Necrozma-DM, and especially Calyrex-S.

  • U-turn is useful for Urshifu-S to effectively scout its switch-ins and maintain momentum for its team.

  • Aerial Ace provides access to Max Airstream to boost Urshifu-S’s Speed, potentially allowing it to sweep faster, frailer teams. Max Airstream also can deny Eternatus the chance to recover against Urshifu-S and stall its Wicked Blow PP.

  • Stone Edge is useful coverage against Ho-Oh, Yveltal and other Flying-types that could potentially survive Wicked Blow and KO Urshifu-S in return.

  • Thunder Punch hits Tapu Fini super effectively in addition to most Flying-types, but it sacrifices some damage against Ho-Oh and Zapdos.

  • Ice Punch can be used to heavily damage targets like Landorus-T and Zygarde while still hitting Yveltal and Zapdos super effectively.

  • Sleep Talk is a niche but effective pick that allows Urshifu-S to absorb sleep from the likes of Hippowdon and Quagsire while maintaining effectiveness; however, Sucker Punch will fail if called by Sleep Talk when Urshifu-S moves last, so it is not advised to use these moves on the same set.

  • If running Choice Band, an Adamant nature is worth considering. While Urshifu-S will no longer outspeed key threats such as Kyogre, Landorus-T, and Mimikyu, the extra power can be very helpful against bulkier teams.

  • Gigantamax is preferred over Dynamax thanks to G-Max One Blow’s ability to ignore Max Guard.

Items

  • Choice Band provides Urshifu-S with absurd power, allowing Wicked Blow to easily 2HKO the likes of Toxapex and Quagsire, and even some resistant Pokémon like Yveltal. Additionally, very few Pokemon can stall out this set, making it particularly effective against stall teams.

  • Choice Scarf lets Urshifu-S outspeed usually-faster targets, letting it revenge kill or grab a surprise KO, securing your team an early lead.

Glastrier.overview:
This analysis covers a newly introduced Pokemon. The metagame may shift rapidly. If you have any suggestions for this analysis, please post them in the current Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Thread.

Viability Ranking: A+ Rank

Reserved for Pokemon that are fantastic in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame, and can sweep, support, or wall significant portions of the metagame. These Pokemon require less support than most others to be used effectively and have few flaws that can easily be overlooked when compared to their positive traits.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

sets.name: Chilling Dynamax Sweeper
sets.description:
• Glastrier's insane bulk, power, and Chilling Neigh make it a fearsome Dynamax sweeper, especially under Trick Room.

  • Icicle Spear breaks through Focus Sash and Disguise, making it the ideal STAB once Dynamax has run out. Icicle Crash deals more consistent damage outside of Dynamax, and can flinch foes under Trick Room or with Custap Berry.

  • Heavy Slam gives Glastrier access to the valuable Max Steelspike while Dynamaxed.

  • Endure can be useful when used with Custap Berry to give Glastrier one priority attack.

  • Glastrier becomes a far more deadly Pokemon when it has Trick Room support. Cresselia is the best choice for this, since it can use Lunar Dance to give Glastrier another chance to sweep through teams, and even let it Dynamax early. Mimikyu and Porygon2 are also good users of Trick Room.

Items

  • Weakness Policy pairs perfectly with Dynamax, giving Glastrier another way to sweep teams.

  • Custap Berry can make revenge killing Glastrier extra difficult when it's low on health, giving it one attack with higher priority.

  • Assault Vest makes Glastrier even more difficult to take down on the special side, and pairs especially well with Dynamax.

  • Lum Berry can be paired with Swords Dance to severly punish Yawn leads such as Hippowdon and Swampert, and also to worry less about common Will-O-Wisp users such as Rotom-W.

Spectrier.overview:
This analysis covers a newly introduced Pokemon. The metagame may shift rapidly. If you have any suggestions for this analysis, please post them in the current Battle Stadium Singles Analysis Thread.

Viability Ranking: B Rank

Reserved for Pokemon that are great in the Battle Stadium Singles metagame. These Pokemon have more notable flaws than those above them that affect how they function in the format. Their positive traits still outshine their negatives, but they require a bit more team support to bring out their full potential.

For more information on viability rankings, check out the full rankings here.

sets.name: Ghost Rider
sets.description:
• Spectrier serves as a fragile but potent offensive sweeper, utilizing a very easily spammed Shadow Ball STAB option, high Speed tier, and Grim Neigh to overwhelm defensively oriented teams.

  • Hyper Beam and Dark Pulse help Spectrier break through Normal-type Pokemon, and have the added bonus of dropping Speed and Special Defense, respectively, when Dynamaxed.

  • Will-O-Wisp and Mud Shot allow Spectrier to provide surprisingly good support for teammates, as opponents need to respect Spectrier's offensive capabilities, leaving them vulnerable the two crippling moves.

  • Substitute or Taunt are also great options for helping Spectrier take advantage of passive Pokemon, allowing it to setup Nasty Plot against unsuspecting foes.

Items

  • Life Orb maximizes Spectrier's power, and puts less pressure on it needing to set up Nasty Plot to sweep.

  • Spell Tag is a decent alternative if Life Orb is used by another Pokemon on your team.

  • Lum Berry gives Spectrier an alternate means to set up on more passive Pokemon, such as Hippowdon and Swampert.

EV Spreads

  • 36 Def / 252 SpA / 220 Spe Timid: Allows Spectrier to outspeed 252 EV invested neutral Dragapult while gaining a bit more physical bulk to take advantage of burned foes.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description:
• Spectrier runs a fairly simple Choice Scarf set, using its top Speed tier in order to revenge kill and snowball against opponents with its Grim Neigh boosts.

  • Hyper Beam is usually picked to increase damage output, but Uproar can also be opted for to avoid a turn cooldown when not Dynamaxed and avoid falling asleep.

  • Dark Pulse allows Spectrier to drop foes' Special Defense when Dynamaxed, Will-O-Wisp lets Spectrier serve as an emergency control against physical sweepers while also providing a Max Guard option, and Mud Shot allows Spectrier provide Speed control while also boosting its own Special Defense with Max Quake.
